content.description: This climb is on the Lower Walt's Rock at the west end. Thin face climbing past three bolts (technical crux) gains a shallow lieback crack on a right facing wall. From the ground the crack looks like it can be easily protected but placements are sparse because it is flared! Make committing moves (10+ / 11-) between small TCU's until a large jug is reached just below the top.
content.protection: QD' s for 3 bolts (1/4"?), small TCU's (#0 - #3), and stoppers provide ample pro. Use medium cams for an anchor on a large ledge. The descent heads west on the ledge followed by downclimbing into a gully. Walk back east to the base of the route.

content.description: Thin crack start first 40 ft (thin cams,nuts) opens to perfect fingers then hands in a slot, a few layback moves to the top. Two cruxes, one in the beginning (thin and balancy) another one in the slot/flare near the top.
content.protection: Good gear everywhere on this one. Bring the thin gear, lots of finger size up to #1 Camalot. Trad anchor and walk off right through a vegetation choked gully (not bad).
content.location: Located on the Lower Walts Rocks. Follow approach as per Walts, but before you climb up to White Rain Area, hike left out of the main approach wash well below Upper Walts. Easy approach from the wash then boulder hop to the base.

content.description: This steep sport route starts off via another boulder and face climbs past a crux bulge via 9 bolts to a bolted anchor.
content.location: On a semi detached pillar left of Perfect Fingers

content.description: Take the left-leaning ramp with a hand crack to the somewhat awkward flaring chimney with a thin finger crack (crux).  Pull a small roof to finish.  Good pro the whole way.
content.protection:
Thin to 3", slings

No fixed gear/anchors.
content.location: Route is just to the left of the large pinnacle.  Walk off the back side.

content.description: This route begins on the far eastern end of Lower Walt's Rock. Steep face climbing leads to a technical and powerful crux past the 2nd bolt. A nice finger crack (10-) is accessed just beyond the bulge at the crux and leads to the top. Three out of five stars.
content.protection: QD's for 2 bolts, stoppers, and small to medium TCU's / cams to 2" for pro. Small to medium cams are needed for an anchor. The descent is an easy walkoff to the east.
